abstract_summ: The results show that: i) ARIMA models are reliable enough when new daily cases begin to stabilize; ii) Italy, the USA, and Russia reached the peak of COVID-19 infections in mid-April, mid-May, and late May, respectively; and iii) Russia and the USA will require much more time than Italy to drop COVID-19 cases near zero.Necessary strict public health measures should be implemented as soon as possible in other European countries with a high number of COVID-19 cases.Our results also reveal that of the 51 countries with reported COVID-19 cases, only nine, including South Africa, Egypt and Ethiopia, are likely to report higher monthly COVID-19 cases in June 2020 than those reported in the previous months.Results: In the eSIR model, we estimated that the mean of basic reproductive number for COVID-19 was 4.34 (95% CI, 3.04–6.00) in Italy and 3.16 (95% CI, 1.73–5.25) in Hunan.Data shows that the number of new COVID-19 cases in Poland beyond May 18 is linear what could be a prognosis of a duration of the epidemic exceeding 300 days.
title_summ: Predictions using the SIR Model Indicate the Cases are FallingForecasting COVID-19 pandemic in Poland according to government regulations and people behaviorARIMA forecasting of COVID-19 incidence in Italy, Russia, and the USAA Statistical Modeling of the Course of COVID-19 (SARS-CoV-2) Outbreak: A Comparative AnalysisExtended SIR Prediction of the Epidemics Trend of COVID-19 in Italy and Compared With Hunan, ChinaThe COVID-19 Pandemic in Africa:
title_abstract_phrases: The results show that: i) ARIMA models are reliable enough when new daily cases begin to stabilize; ii) Italy, the USA, and Russia reached the peak of COVID-19 infections in mid-April, mid-May, and late May, respectively; and iii) Russia and the USA will require much more time than Italy to drop COVID-19 cases near zero.Our results also reveal that of the 51 countries with reported COVID-19 cases, only nine, including South Africa, Egypt and Ethiopia, are likely to report higher monthly COVID-19 cases in June 2020 than those reported in the previous months.Necessary strict public health measures should be implemented as soon as possible in other European countries with a high number of COVID-19 cases.Results: In the eSIR model, we estimated that the mean of basic reproductive number for COVID-19 was 4.34 (95% CI, 3.04–6.00) in Italy and 3.16 (95% CI, 1.73–5.25) in Hunan.ARIMA forecasting of COVID-19 incidence in Italy, Russia, and the USAThe novel Coronavirus disease (COVID-19) is a severe respiratory infection that officially occurred in Wuhan, China, in December 2019.
